text: The retreat from international trade is the cornerstone of Donald Trump ' s quest to assume the presidency. According to Trump, the trade deficit is much larger than the volume of goods and services imported by the United States from its exports. "Our trade deficit in goods is almost - think about this - our trade deficit of $800 billion last year alone," said Trump on July 21, at the National Republican Congress in Cleveland. "We're gonna fix this." The Trump formula is a little weird, but he got the idea right. According to census data, the country ' s overall trade deficit in 2015 was approximately $500 billion, but this figure includes both goods and services. Trump referred to the trade deficit in goods, which included all manufactured products, oil and agricultural products. The trade deficit in 2015 for fair goods was $763 billion. Not quite $800 billion, but reasonably close. The reason that the overall trade deficit is less than the mere merchandise trade deficit is that United States exports of services exceed what they import.
